DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to understand how different physical therapy interventions affect the use of certain abdominal muscles in patients with low back pain.
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with low back pain will undergo ultrasound imaging of the lateral abdominal wall to measure resting and contracted thickness of the transversus abdominis muscle. Following the pre-intervention measurement, patients will receive one of two physical therapy interventions (side lying thrust joint manipulation or side lying non-thrust oscillations into slight rotation) which will have been randomly assigned. Immediately after intervention, ultrasound imaging will be repeated on the resting and contracted thickness of the transversus abdominis.
DOC.criteria: Currently receiving physical therapy treatment for back pain or back pain symptoms 1870 years of age Able to perform the abdominal drawing in maneuver Presence of a serious pathology Diagnosis of spinal stenosis or symptoms in both lower legs (changes in sensation, muscle weakness) Any history of low back surgery, rheumatoid arthritis, osteoporosis, osteopenia, or ankylosing spondylitis
